text: Luigi's Mansion is a 2001 video game released for the Nintendo GameCube. It was developed, created, and released by Nintendo. This game has a sequel for the Nintendo 3DS: Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon, which supports tilt motion. It was released in North America on March 24, 2013. == Plot == Luigi has won a mansion in a contest which he did not enter, and he requests that Mario checks the mansion first. When Luigi realizes that Mario has been long absent, he heads off to the Mansion in search of him. In contrast to the mansion shown on his flyer, Luigi notices that it is old, haunted, and inhabited by multiple ghosts. Around the start of his adventure, Luigi meets Professor E. Gadd, who gives him the Poltergust 3000, a vacuum cleaner that can capture ghosts. == References == Category:2001 video games Category:Action-adventure games Category:Luigi games Category:Nintendo 3DS eShop games Category:Nintendo 3DS games Category:Nintendo Entertainment Analysis and Development games Category:Nintendo GameCube games Category:Single-player video games Category:Video game remakes Category:Video games about ghosts Category:Video games developed in Japan
